content: Yes, that's one of the unique aspects of Hinduism, where every aspect of divinity is venerated and forms an integral part of the larger framework of the religion. In Hindu mythology, Lord Shiva and Nandi are inseparable, and the gatekeeper serves as a reminder of the importance of humility, devotion, and spiritual discipline in the quest for transcendence. Seeking blessings from Nandi before worshipping Lord Shiva is a reminder that even the smallest aspects of divinity are worthy of our reverence, and no aspect of the divine realm should be ignored or overlooked.
